VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Emergency Medical Center?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Emergency Medical Center is arc {Tertiary General Hospital}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Emergency Medical Center?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Emergency Medical Center is arc {Geriatric Care Hospital}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Emergency Medical Center} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Commdata_unity Health Center} has the largest input flow.

What is the flow value from Emergency Medical Center to Commdata_unity Health Center in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Emergency Medical Center to Tertiary General Hospital in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Geriatric Care Hospital and Emergency Medical Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Geriatric Care Hospital and Emergency Medical Center is {64}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Tertiary General Hospital and Emergency Medical Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Tertiary General Hospital and Emergency Medical Center is {168}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Tertiary General Hospital?
SC.A: The total flow output from Tertiary General Hospital is {389}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Commdata_unity Health Center?
SC.A: The total flow input by Commdata_unity Health Center is {296}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 227? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {234} from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Commdata_unity Health Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 90? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {36} from {Geriatric Care Hospital} to {Emergency Medical Center}, a flow of {64} from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Geriatric Care Hospital}, a flow of {62} from {Tertiary General Hospital} to {Commdata_unity Health Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 117 and 169? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {117} from {Tertiary General Hospital} to {Geriatric Care Hospital}, a flow of {168} from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Tertiary General Hospital}, a flow of {118} from {Commdata_unity Health Center} to {Tertiary General Hospital}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Tertiary General Hospital to Emergency Medical Center or from Commdata_unity Health Center to Tertiary General Hospital?
NC.A: The flow from {Tertiary General Hospital} to {Emergency Medical Center} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Emergency Medical Center to Tertiary General Hospital, from Emergency Medical Center to Commdata_unity Health Center, or from Commdata_unity Health Center to Tertiary General Hospital?
NC.A: The flow from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Commdata_unity Health Center} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Geriatric Care Hospital}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Commdata_unity Health Center} and {Emergency Medical Center}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Geriatric Care Hospital, Arc Tertiary General Hospital, Arc Emergency Medical Center, Arc Commdata_unity Health Center}.
